alert.note: Alert for Mercer (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 30 at 7:49AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding continues along the Bluestone River near Spanishburg, WV. * WHERE...Parts of Mercer County in southeast West Virginia. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is still occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 739 AM EDT, the Bluestone River was at 16.0 feet and still causing moderate flooding. The river crested at 16.5 feet earlier this morning and is now falling. It will eventually fall below the flood stage of 12.0 feet sometime this evening. - At 15.0 feet, the Spanishburg Elementary School and Rich Creek Baptist Church may be affected by flood waters. In addition, numerous sections of U.S. Route 19 south of Spanishburg may be flooded. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Camp Creek, Spanishburg, and Kegley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
